intro: Amblyanthe squamifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf amblyanthe, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Amblyanthe squamifera is often found in moist, shady environments in tropical regions.
